author: TNN
title: Brrr! Biting cold holds Bhopal, no respite for now | Bhopal News - Times of India
text: BHOPAL: Bhopalites continued to woke up to spine-chilling winter morning on Friday after the minimum temperature was recorded at 7.8 degrees Celsius, which was a degree more than a day earlier, but less than normal. The biting cold is set to prevail for a few days in several places of the state, including Bhopal. 116305682The day temperature in Bhopal on Friday was recorded at 22 degrees Celsius, four degrees less than the normal mark, while the night temperature in the city was 7.8 degrees Celsius, three degrees less than the normal mark. A minimum temperature of 3.1 degrees Celsius was recorded in Shahdol.In the forecast for Bhopal on Saturday, the meteorological department stated there would be a clear sky and haze in the morning. The day and night temperatures would be 24 degrees Celsius and 9 degrees Celsius, respectively, while the average wind speed would be 10km per hour.In the forecast for the state, a warning of a cold day at isolated places in Bhopal, Vidisha, Raisen, Sehore, Rajgarh, Shajapur, Neemuch, Sidhi, Katni, Betul, Ratlam, Agar, Narsinghpur, Mandsaur, and Mandla was issued.A warning of coldwave was issued for isolated places in Narmadapuram, Rewa, Mauganj, Satna, Shahdol, Umaria, Dindori, Jabalpur, Seoni, Mandla, Panna, Chhatarpur, Tikamgarh, Niwari, and Maihar districts.The weather would be dry over the remaining places in the state.
